column4: hey, anybody tell me why i can't get gstreamer0.8-lame on an amd64 version of hoary?
no, i'm not
is there any way i could build it myself?
so could anybody help me with building gstreamer0.8-lame?
why build it?
if its not in the ubuntu archive, its probably becaus it didn't compile.  But, if your using Hoary it should be in the archive. Are you using restricted and universe?
there is no package with the name gstreamer0.8-lame.  I cant find it either.
and im using i386
what made you think that there should exist such a package by the way? maybe its called something else?
the ubuntu docs made me think it exists
which doc? could you point me to that page?
gstreamer0.8-mad  will give you mp3 support, if thats the package you are looking for.. ?
i'm looking for encoding
i've already gotten the mad package, they play fine
if you read more carefully it says on that page that it is in Hoary-extras.  I dont know where that repositorie is :(
section 2.2 on that page will tell you how to configure so that you get the hoary-extra repositorie. After that, you can install gstreamer0.8-lame  :)
it doesn't show at all, or it shows the wrong version?
no show
have you ran "sudo apt-get update" (or updated the list in synaptic) ?
and you ran that *after* you added the hoary-extra  right?
and just did it again
that meen you should file a bug on bugzilla.ubuntu.com, perhaps?  or ask those who maintain hoary-extra :)
